Class MainDirectoryManager

Manager for main directory model.

Inheritance: BaseManager<T, TService> -> MainDirectoryManager
Implements: ICRUDManager<T, TService>, IMainDirectoryManager, IManager<T, TService> 

public sealed class MainDirectoryManager : BaseManager<MainDirectory, MainDirectoryService>, IMainDirectoryManager, ICRUDManager<MainDirectory, MainDirectoryService>, IManager<MainDirectory, MainDirectoryService>

Constructors

MainDirectoryManager()

Initializes a new instance of the MainDirectoryManager class and all it's properties.

public MainDirectoryManager()

Remarks

Sets Service to newly created MainDirectoryService object. If services collection is empty, it asks user for an input to create MainDirectory object. Next it sets SelectedItem to the identifier of the first object of services collection. At last it sets SelectedFileManager and IgnoredFileManager properties by creating appropriate new objects connected with this managers service.

See Also

MainDirectory

IgnoreFile(FileInfo)

Moves file from selected to ignored collection.

public void IgnoreFile(FileInfo file)

Parameters

file FileInfo

The file to ignore.

Remarks

If specified file is associated with selected file object connected with selected item it is deleted from selected file service collection, converted to ignored file object and added to ignored file service collection. If there is no appropriate object in selected file service collection, nothing happens.

See Also
MainDirectoryService
ICRUDManager<T, TService>
IMainDirectoryManager
IManager<T, TService>
BaseManager<T, TService>
MainDirectory

IgnoreFile(FileInfo, MainDirectory?)

Moves file from selected to ignored collection.

public void IgnoreFile(FileInfo file, MainDirectory? mainDirectory)

Parameters

file FileInfo

The file to ignore.

mainDirectory MainDirectory

The main directory that file is connected with.

Remarks

If specified file is associated with selected file object connected with mainDirectory it is deleted from selected file service collection, converted to ignored file object and added to ignored file service collection. If there is no appropriate object in selected file service collection, nothing happens.

See Also
